alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 19 at 2:09PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Warm Temperatures Through Friday Followed By Sharp Cooling On The Weekend... Strong high pressure building over the Interior today and Thursday is causing mostly sunny skies and much warmer temperatures. Highs will be in the 30s to near 40 today, in the upper 30s to upper 40s on Thursday, and near 40 Friday. Lows will be in the teens and 20s. On Friday and Friday night, a strong cold front will move south over the Eastern Interior bringing much colder temperatures for the weekend. The cold temperatures will continue into next week. This cold front will bring northeast winds gusting to 25 mph over much of the Interior from Friday into Saturday, with gusts to 40 mph along with blowing snow through Brooks Range Passes and over Interior highway summits from Friday evening into Saturday. Light snow or flurries will spread south with the cold front over the Eastern Interior on Friday and continue into Saturday.

area.areaDesc: Central Interior; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands
